description: Tension in the mind, tightness in the body. Let's release it.

art.title: The Stress Monster
art.instruction: Draw your stress as a creature. Give it a name, shape, and color. Then transform it by adding calming elements - maybe flowers growing from it, or soft colors surrounding it. As you draw, repeat: 'I'm transforming my stress into strength.'
art.affirmation: I release tension through creative expression

art.title: Tension Release Mandala
art.instruction: Draw a circle and fill it with repetitive patterns that represent your tension. Start with jagged lines for stress, then gradually make them smoother and more flowing as you work outward. End with gentle curves and spirals.

art.title: Calming Color Wash
art.instruction: Using watercolors or soft pastels, create gentle washes of blue and green across your paper. Let the colors blend and flow naturally. Focus only on creating soothing color combinations that represent peace.
art.affirmation: I paint my way to peace

art.title: Peaceful Place Collage
art.instruction: Create a collage of images that represent peace to you - nature scenes, cozy spaces, gentle colors. Arrange them mindfully, focusing on creating a visual sanctuary you can return to mentally.

art.title: Stress Scribble Release
art.instruction: On a large paper, scribble out all your stress with bold, chaotic lines. Use dark colors for tension. Then, on a new paper, draw gentle, flowing lines with lighter colors. Feel the contrast.
art.affirmation: I release what weighs me down

art.title: Clay Stress Sculpture
art.instruction: Mold clay into the shape of your stress - sharp, twisted, heavy. Then slowly reshape it into something beautiful and smooth. Feel your hands transforming the tension.
art.affirmation: My hands heal what my mind carries

art.title: Worry Stone Painting
art.instruction: Find a smooth stone and paint it with calming colors and patterns. As you paint, imagine transferring all your worries into the stone, then covering them with peace and beauty.

art.title: Stress Timeline Art
art.instruction: Draw a timeline of your stress from past to future. Mark the stressful moments with dark colors, then add bright colors for moments of relief and joy. See stress as temporary.
art.affirmation: This stress is temporary, my strength is eternal

art.title: Body Stress Map
art.instruction: Draw an outline of your body and color in where you feel stress - red for tense areas, yellow for mild tension. Then add cooling colors like blue and green to 'heal' those areas.
art.affirmation: I listen to my body and respond with kindness

art.title: Dream Garden Visualization Art
art.instruction: Draw or paint your ideal peaceful garden where stress cannot exist. Include elements that make you feel calm - flowers, water, soft paths. This is your stress-free mental retreat.
art.affirmation: I cultivate peace in my inner garden

breathwork.title: 4-7-8 Stress Relief Breath
breathwork.instruction: Inhale through your nose for 4 counts, hold for 7 counts, exhale through your mouth for 8 counts making a 'whoosh' sound. Repeat 4 times. Feel your nervous system calming with each exhale.
breathwork.affirmation: My breath is my anchor to calm

breathwork.title: Ocean Wave Breathing
breathwork.instruction: Breathe in slowly like a wave building, hold briefly at the peak, then exhale like the wave crashing on shore. Visualize each wave washing away your stress and tension.
breathwork.affirmation: I flow with life's natural rhythms

breathwork.title: Square Breathing
breathwork.instruction: Breathe in for 4, hold for 4, breathe out for 4, hold empty for 4. Visualize drawing a perfect square with your breath, creating stability and calm in your mind and body.
breathwork.affirmation: I create stability through my breath

breathwork.title: Balloon Belly Breathing
breathwork.instruction: Place one hand on chest, one on belly. Breathe so only the belly hand moves, like inflating a balloon. Count 'balloon up' on inhale, 'balloon down' on exhale. Feel deep relaxation.

breathwork.title: Color Breathing
breathwork.instruction: Inhale cool blue or green light, visualizing it filling your body with calm. Exhale warm red or orange light, releasing all stress and tension. Continue this colorful breath cycle.
breathwork.affirmation: I breathe in peace and breathe out stress

breathwork.title: Counted Exhale Breathing
breathwork.instruction: Breathe in normally, then exhale counting slowly from 10 down to 1. If you lose count, simply start again at 10. This redirects anxious thoughts to the present moment.
breathwork.affirmation: I focus my mind through breath

breathwork.title: Humming Bee Breath
breathwork.instruction: Close your ears with your thumbs, index fingers above eyebrows, other fingers closed over eyes. Hum as you exhale, feeling the vibration calm your nervous system.
breathwork.affirmation: I vibrate at the frequency of peace

breathwork.title: Stress Melting Breath
breathwork.instruction: With each inhale, imagine breathing in warmth and light. With each exhale, visualize stress melting away from your body like ice in sunlight, leaving you refreshed.
breathwork.affirmation: Stress melts away with each breath

breathwork.title: Three-Part Breath
breathwork.instruction: Breathe into your belly (hand on belly rises), then ribcage (ribs expand), then chest (chest rises slightly). Exhale in reverse order. This fully oxygenates and calms you.
breathwork.affirmation: I breathe fully into every part of my being

breathwork.title: Cooling Breath
breathwork.instruction: Curl your tongue and inhale through it like a straw (or purse lips if you can't curl). Feel the cool air. Exhale normally through nose. This naturally cools stress and agitation.
breathwork.affirmation: I cool the fire of stress with my breath

somatic.title: Progressive Stress Release
somatic.instruction: Starting with your toes, tense each muscle group for 5 seconds, then release completely. Feel the contrast between tension and relaxation. Work your way up to your head, releasing stress from each part.
somatic.affirmation: My body knows how to heal and relax

somatic.title: Shoulder Drop & Roll
somatic.instruction: Notice where you hold stress in your shoulders. Slowly lift them to your ears, hold for 3 seconds, then drop them completely. Roll them backward 5 times, forward 5 times. Feel the release.
somatic.affirmation: I release the weight I carry in my shoulders

somatic.title: Stress Shake-Out
somatic.instruction: Stand and gently shake your hands, then arms, then whole body. Animals naturally shake to release stress and trauma. Shake for 2 minutes, then stand still and notice the sensations.
somatic.affirmation: I shake off what no longer serves me

somatic.title: Jaw Release Massage
somatic.instruction: Place your fingers on your temples and make small circles. Move to your jaw muscles and massage gently. Open and close your mouth slowly. We hold lots of stress in our jaw.
somatic.affirmation: I release tension from every part of my face

somatic.title: Neck Tension Release
somatic.instruction: Slowly turn your head right, hold 10 seconds. Turn left, hold 10 seconds. Tilt ear to shoulder on each side. Roll head in gentle circles. Breathe into any tight spots.
somatic.affirmation: I free my neck from the burden of stress

somatic.title: Foot Grounding Exercise
somatic.instruction: Stand barefoot and feel your feet connecting to the ground. Lift your toes, press them down. Rock forward and back, side to side. Feel yourself rooted and supported by the earth.
somatic.affirmation: I am grounded, supported, and stable

somatic.title: Heart Opening Stretch
somatic.instruction: Sit tall, clasp hands behind your back. Lift chest and squeeze shoulder blades together. Hold 30 seconds. This releases stress stored in the chest and opens your heart space.
somatic.affirmation: I open my heart to peace and joy

somatic.title: Gentle Spinal Twist
somatic.instruction: Sit cross-legged, place right hand behind you, left hand on right knee. Gently twist right, hold, breathe. Repeat left. This wrings out stress from your core and spine.
somatic.affirmation: I wring out tension and twist into ease

somatic.title: Hip Circle Release
somatic.instruction: Stand with hands on hips. Make slow, large circles with your hips - 5 each direction. We store emotions in our hips. Breathe and let whatever comes up move through you.
somatic.affirmation: I free my hips and release stored emotions

somatic.title: Whole Body Stretch Wave
somatic.instruction: Stand with arms overhead. Slowly wave your body like seaweed, starting from your fingers down to your toes. Let the wave motion release tension from head to toe. Move fluidly.
somatic.affirmation: I flow like water, releasing all that binds me

cbt.title: Stress Thought Challenge
cbt.instruction: Write down your stressful thoughts. Ask: Is this thought realistic? What evidence do I have? What would I tell a friend in this situation? Rewrite each thought in a more balanced way.
cbt.affirmation: I have power over my thoughts

cbt.title: The Worry Time Technique
cbt.instruction: Schedule 15 minutes as your daily 'worry time.' When stressful thoughts arise outside this time, write them down and tell yourself 'I'll think about this during worry time.' This contains your stress.
cbt.affirmation: I choose when to engage with worry

cbt.title: Evidence Examination
cbt.instruction: For each stressful belief, create two columns: 'Evidence For' and 'Evidence Against.' Fill both sides honestly. Often you'll find the evidence against is stronger than you thought.
cbt.affirmation: I examine my thoughts with curiosity, not judgment

cbt.title: Catastrophic Thinking Scale
cbt.instruction: Rate your stressful situation from 1-10. Then ask: 'What would a 10 actually look like?' Often you'll realize your situation is a 3-5, not the 9 it feels like emotionally.
cbt.affirmation: I see situations clearly, not through the lens of stress

cbt.title: Best Friend Advice
cbt.instruction: Write about your stressful situation. Then write the advice you'd give your best friend if they came to you with this exact problem. We're often kinder to others than ourselves.
cbt.affirmation: I treat myself with the same kindness I show my friends

cbt.title: Thought Stopping Technique
cbt.instruction: When you notice a stressful thought loop, say 'STOP' out loud or visualize a red stop sign. Then immediately redirect to a prepared positive thought or calming image.
cbt.affirmation: I control my thoughts; they don't control me

cbt.title: Stress Reframe Practice
cbt.instruction: Write your stressful situation. Then rewrite it three different ways: as a challenge to overcome, a learning opportunity, and a chance to grow stronger. Find the empowering perspective.
cbt.affirmation: I choose empowering perspectives on life's challenges

cbt.title: Future Self Wisdom
cbt.instruction: Imagine yourself 5 years from now, having successfully handled this stress. What would that wiser future you tell current you about this situation? Write their advice.
cbt.affirmation: I trust in my ability to handle whatever comes

cbt.title: Stress Belief Investigation
cbt.instruction: Identify the core belief behind your stress (e.g., 'I must be perfect'). Ask: Where did this belief come from? Is it helping or hurting me now? What would I believe instead?
cbt.affirmation: I choose beliefs that serve my wellbeing

cbt.title: Problem vs. Worry Sorting
cbt.instruction: List your stressors. Sort them into 'Problems I can solve' and 'Worries I can't control.' Make action plans for problems, acceptance practices for worries.
cbt.affirmation: I focus my energy where I have power to create change

rebt.title: Must vs. Prefer Challenge
rebt.instruction: Identify thoughts with 'must,' 'should,' or 'have to.' Replace them: 'I must be perfect' becomes 'I prefer to do well, but making mistakes is human and okay.' Feel the pressure decrease.

rebt.title: Awfulizing Reality Check
rebt.instruction: When you think something is 'awful' or 'terrible,' ask: 'Is this truly the worst thing that could happen? What percentage awful is this really?' Often it's inconvenient, not awful.
rebt.affirmation: I see challenges as inconveniences, not catastrophes

rebt.title: I Can't Stand It vs. I Don't Like It
rebt.instruction: Replace 'I can't stand this' with 'I don't like this, but I can handle it.' You've survived 100% of your difficult days so far. You're stronger than you think.
rebt.affirmation: I can handle whatever life brings my way

rebt.title: Worthless vs. Fallible Human
rebt.instruction: Challenge thoughts that label you as 'worthless' or 'failure.' Replace with: 'I'm a fallible human who sometimes makes mistakes, and that's perfectly normal and acceptable.'
rebt.affirmation: My worth is not determined by my performance

rebt.title: Demand vs. Wish Transformation
rebt.instruction: Transform demanding thoughts: 'Life must be fair' becomes 'I wish life were always fair, but it often isn't, and I can still find meaning and joy.' Demands create stress; wishes allow peace.
rebt.affirmation: I wish for the best while accepting what is

rebt.title: Global vs. Specific Labeling
rebt.instruction: Replace global labels like 'I'm stupid' with specific observations: 'I made a mistake in this specific situation.' You are not your behaviors; you're a complex, valuable person.
rebt.affirmation: I am more than any single action or mistake

rebt.title: Approval Need Challenge
rebt.instruction: Question the belief 'I need everyone's approval.' Ask: 'Do I approve of everyone? Is it possible or necessary for everyone to like me?' Practice self-approval instead.
rebt.affirmation: My self-worth comes from within, not from others' opinions

rebt.title: Comfort Zone Rationality
rebt.instruction: Challenge 'I can't handle discomfort.' Remember times you've handled difficult emotions before. Discomfort is temporary and survivable, not dangerous or permanent.
rebt.affirmation: I can handle temporary discomfort for long-term growth

rebt.title: Certainty vs. Probability
rebt.instruction: Replace 'What if something terrible happens?' with 'What are the actual probabilities?' Most of what we worry about never happens. Focus on likely, not possible, outcomes.
rebt.affirmation: I focus on probabilities, not possibilities

rebt.title: Rational Coping Statements
rebt.instruction: Create rational responses to your irrational stress thoughts. Practice phrases like: 'This is difficult, not impossible,' 'I prefer things to go well, but I can handle setbacks.'
rebt.affirmation: I respond to life's challenges with rational thinking

neural.title: Calm Anchor Installation
neural.instruction: Recall a time you felt completely calm and peaceful. Anchor this feeling by pressing your thumb and forefinger together while visualizing that moment. Practice this daily to create an instant calm trigger.
neural.affirmation: I can access calm whenever I need it

neural.title: Stress Pattern Interrupt
neural.instruction: Notice your stress pattern: thoughts → feelings → behaviors. Create a new pattern: stress thought → take 3 deep breaths → positive affirmation → calming action. Repeat until it becomes automatic.
neural.affirmation: I create new pathways to peace

neural.title: Confident Self Visualization
neural.instruction: Visualize yourself handling a stressful situation with complete confidence and calm. See yourself breathing easily, thinking clearly, feeling grounded. Rehearse this mental movie daily.
neural.affirmation: I am calm, confident, and capable

neural.title: Success Memory Installation
neural.instruction: Recall a time you successfully handled stress. Amplify this memory - see it brighter, hear it clearer, feel it stronger. This becomes your template for handling future stress.
neural.affirmation: I have successfully handled challenges before and I can do it again

neural.title: Stress-Free Identity Rehearsal
neural.instruction: Imagine yourself as someone who naturally stays calm under pressure. How do they walk, talk, breathe? Mentally rehearse being this calm person throughout your day.
neural.affirmation: I am naturally calm and centered

neural.title: Neuroplasticity Meditation
neural.instruction: As you relax, tell your brain: 'I'm creating new neural pathways of peace.' Visualize these pathways as golden threads connecting calm thoughts to calm feelings and actions.
neural.affirmation: My brain is creating new pathways to peace and calm

neural.title: Stress Response Rewiring
neural.instruction: Practice responding to imagined stress with immediate calm breathing instead of tension. Mentally rehearse: stressor appears → instant calm breath → relaxed response. Train this new automatic response.
neural.affirmation: I automatically respond to challenges with calm and clarity

neural.title: Peaceful Future Self
neural.instruction: Visualize yourself 6 months from now, having mastered stress management. Feel how peaceful and confident this future you is. Let this version of yourself teach you their secrets.
neural.affirmation: I am becoming more peaceful and resilient every day

neural.title: Calm Command Installation
neural.instruction: Choose a word like 'peace' or 'calm.' While deeply relaxed, repeat this word and associate it with feelings of complete tranquility. Use this word as your instant calm trigger.
neural.affirmation: I have instant access to deep calm and peace

neural.title: Stress Resilience Programming
neural.instruction: Imagine stress as water and yourself as a mountain - solid, unshakeable, letting the water flow around you without being moved. Install this resilient identity deep in your subconscious.
neural.affirmation: I am unshakeable in the face of life's storms

journaling.title: Stress Story Rewrite
journaling.instruction: Write about your stressful situation as if you're the hero of your own story. What challenges are you facing? What strengths do you have? How will you overcome this? Write your triumphant ending.
journaling.affirmation: I am the author of my own story

journaling.title: Stress Dialogue Journal
journaling.instruction: Write a conversation between you and your stress. Let your stress speak first - what is it trying to tell you? Then respond with compassion and wisdom. Find the message within the tension.
journaling.affirmation: I listen to my stress with compassion and wisdom

journaling.title: Gratitude in Stress Journal
journaling.instruction: Even in stressful times, write 5 things you're grateful for today. Include one thing about the stressful situation that might lead to growth or positive change. Find the hidden gifts.
journaling.affirmation: I find blessings even in challenging times

journaling.title: Stress Release Stream
journaling.instruction: Set a timer for 10 minutes and write continuously about your stress without stopping or editing. Let everything flow out onto paper. Then tear up the paper as a symbolic release.
journaling.affirmation: I release my burdens onto paper and let them go

journaling.title: Future Self Letter
journaling.instruction: Write a letter from your future self (who has overcome this stress) to your current self. What wisdom, encouragement, and guidance would this wiser version of you offer?
journaling.affirmation: My future self guides me with wisdom and love

journaling.title: Stress Pattern Recognition
journaling.instruction: Write about your stress patterns: What triggers you? How does your body respond? What thoughts arise? Recognizing patterns is the first step to changing them.
journaling.affirmation: Awareness of my patterns gives me power to change them

journaling.title: Stress Lessons Journal
journaling.instruction: Write about what this stressful experience is teaching you. How is it making you stronger? What skills are you developing? Find the growth within the challenge.
journaling.affirmation: Every challenge teaches me valuable lessons

journaling.title: Compassionate Self-Talk
journaling.instruction: Write down your inner critic's harsh words about your stress. Then rewrite them as if your most compassionate friend were speaking to you. Practice this kinder internal voice.
journaling.affirmation: I speak to myself with kindness and understanding

journaling.title: Stress Victory Journal
journaling.instruction: Write about times you've successfully handled stress before. Include small victories and major triumphs. You have more strength and resilience than you realize.
journaling.affirmation: I am stronger than my challenges

journaling.title: Ideal Day Without Stress
journaling.instruction: Write in detail about how you'd spend a day if you felt completely peaceful and unstressed. What would you do? How would you feel? This becomes a roadmap for creating more peace.
journaling.affirmation: I create days filled with peace and joy

eft.title: Stress Release Tapping
eft.instruction: While tapping the karate chop point, say: 'Even though I feel stressed, I deeply accept myself.' Tap each point while saying 'This stress' and finish with 'I choose to feel calm and centered.'
eft.affirmation: I tap into my natural healing power

eft.title: Specific Stress Situation Tapping
eft.instruction: Think of your specific stressful situation. Rate the intensity 1-10. Tap while saying 'Even though I'm stressed about [situation], I accept myself.' Continue tapping until intensity drops below 3.
eft.affirmation: I clear stress from my energy system

eft.title: Body Stress Tapping
eft.instruction: Notice where you feel stress in your body. Tap while saying: 'This tension in my shoulders/jaw/stomach... I acknowledge this stress and choose to release it.' Focus on the physical sensations.
eft.affirmation: My body releases stress and returns to natural balance

eft.title: Stress Belief Tapping
eft.instruction: Identify a stressful belief like 'I can't handle this.' Tap while saying: 'Even though I believe I can't handle this, I'm open to feeling capable and strong.' Shift the belief gradually.
eft.affirmation: I release limiting beliefs and embrace my strength

eft.title: Past Stress Memory Tapping
eft.instruction: If current stress reminds you of past events, gently tap while thinking of that memory. Say: 'That was then, this is now. I'm safe and capable of handling life's challenges.'
eft.affirmation: I heal old wounds and create new possibilities

eft.title: Anticipatory Stress Tapping
eft.instruction: For future worries, tap while saying: 'Even though I'm worried about what might happen, I trust in my ability to handle whatever comes.' Clear the stress before it manifests.
eft.affirmation: I face the future with confidence and trust

eft.title: Stress Overwhelm Tapping
eft.instruction: When everything feels like too much, tap while saying: 'Even though I feel overwhelmed, I choose to take things one step at a time. I can handle this.' Break it down into manageable pieces.
eft.affirmation: I handle life one peaceful step at a time

eft.title: Perfectionist Stress Tapping
eft.instruction: For perfectionism-related stress, tap while saying: 'Even though I pressure myself to be perfect, I choose to accept my human imperfection. Good enough is truly good enough.'
eft.affirmation: I embrace my perfectly imperfect humanity

eft.title: Control Stress Tapping
eft.instruction: For stress about things beyond your control, tap: 'Even though I want to control everything, I choose to focus on what I can influence and release the rest with love.'
eft.affirmation: I focus my energy where I have power and release the rest

eft.title: Stress Positive Installation
eft.instruction: After clearing stress, tap in positive statements: 'I am calm and centered... I handle challenges with ease... I trust in my resilience...' Install new, empowering patterns.
eft.affirmation: I install patterns of peace and resilience

emdr.title: Butterfly Hug for Stress
emdr.instruction: Cross your arms over your chest, hands on shoulders. Gently pat alternately left-right while thinking about your stress. Feel it softening and moving through your body. End by imagining stress leaving with each exhale.
emdr.affirmation: I process and release what no longer serves me

emdr.title: Bilateral Knee Tapping
emdr.instruction: Sit comfortably and alternately tap your knees with your hands while thinking about your stressful situation. Let whatever thoughts or feelings arise just pass through without judgment.
emdr.affirmation: I allow difficult emotions to flow through and release

emdr.title: Walking Bilateral Processing
emdr.instruction: Take a slow walk while focusing on your stress. Pay attention to the left-right-left rhythm of your steps. Let this natural bilateral movement help process and release the tension.
emdr.affirmation: Each step carries me toward greater peace

emdr.title: Eye Movement Stress Release
emdr.instruction: While thinking of your stress, slowly move your eyes left and right 20-30 times. Then up and down 20 times. Then in circles. This stimulates the brain's natural processing mechanisms.
emdr.affirmation: My brain naturally knows how to process and heal

emdr.title: Bilateral Sound Processing
emdr.instruction: Listen to bilateral music or sounds that alternate between left and right ears. While listening, gently hold your stressful thoughts and feelings, letting them process naturally.
emdr.affirmation: Sound waves carry away my stress and tension

emdr.title: Safe Place Installation
emdr.instruction: Visualize a completely safe, peaceful place while doing bilateral stimulation (knee tapping or butterfly hugs). Install this as a resource you can access when stress arises.
emdr.affirmation: I carry peace within me wherever I go

emdr.title: Stress Container Visualization
emdr.instruction: Visualize putting your stress into a strong container while doing bilateral movements. Lock it up securely, knowing you can return to process it when you're ready and resourced.
emdr.affirmation: I contain my stress and choose when to process it

emdr.title: Resource Installation EMDR
emdr.instruction: Think of a time you felt strong and capable while doing butterfly hugs. Enhance all the positive feelings, sights, and sounds. Install this resource to access during stressful times.
emdr.affirmation: I am resourced, strong, and capable

emdr.title: Dual Attention Stress Relief
emdr.instruction: Hold your stress gently in awareness while simultaneously noticing the present moment - sounds, sensations, your breathing. This dual attention helps process without overwhelm.
emdr.affirmation: I can hold difficulty while staying present and grounded

emdr.title: Bilateral Breathing
emdr.instruction: Breathe in while tapping your left knee, breathe out while tapping your right knee. Continue this bilateral breathing pattern while gently holding your stressful thoughts.
emdr.affirmation: My breath and body work together to restore balance

yoga.title: Child's Pose Surrender
yoga.instruction: Kneel and sit back on your heels, then fold forward with arms extended or by your sides. Breathe deeply and with each exhale, surrender your stress to the earth. Stay for 5-10 breaths, feeling supported.
yoga.affirmation: I surrender what I cannot control

yoga.title: Cat-Cow Stress Release
yoga.instruction: On hands and knees, arch your back (cow) on inhale, round your spine (cat) on exhale. Let this gentle movement massage your spine and release tension from your core.
yoga.affirmation: I move with my breath and release tension

yoga.title: Legs Up the Wall Pose
yoga.instruction: Lie on your back with legs up against a wall. This restorative pose activates your rest-and-digest system, naturally reducing stress. Breathe deeply and feel your nervous system calming.
yoga.affirmation: I rest and allow my body to restore itself

yoga.title: Gentle Neck Release Sequence
yoga.instruction: Sitting tall, slowly drop your right ear to right shoulder. Hold 30 seconds. Repeat left. Then gently nod yes and shake no. Release the weight of stress from your neck.
yoga.affirmation: I release the weight I carry in my neck and shoulders

yoga.title: Supported Bridge Pose
yoga.instruction: Lie on back, knees bent, feet flat. Lift hips and place a pillow or block underneath for support. This gentle backbend opens the heart and releases stored stress.
yoga.affirmation: I open my heart and release what weighs me down

yoga.title: Seated Forward Fold
yoga.instruction: Sit with legs extended, slowly fold forward over your legs. Don't force it - let gravity do the work. This introspective pose helps you turn inward and find peace.
yoga.affirmation: I turn inward and find the peace that's always there

yoga.title: Gentle Spinal Twist Series
yoga.instruction: Lie on back, drop knees to right side while keeping shoulders down. Hold and breathe. Repeat left. This wrings out stress from your spine like a wet towel.
yoga.affirmation: I wring out tension and welcome ease

yoga.title: Restorative Savasana
yoga.instruction: Lie flat with arms at sides, palms up. Place pillows under knees and head for comfort. Completely surrender your body weight to the earth. Let go of all effort and control.
yoga.affirmation: I completely surrender and trust in the support beneath me

yoga.title: Heart Opening Flow
yoga.instruction: Move slowly between camel pose, cobra pose, and fish pose, holding each for 5 breaths. Open your heart space and release stress stored in your chest.
yoga.affirmation: I open my heart to love and release fear

yoga.title: Grounding Mountain Pose
yoga.instruction: Stand tall with feet hip-width apart. Feel your connection to the earth through your feet. Breathe and embody the strength and stability of a mountain. You are unshakeable.
yoga.affirmation: I am grounded, stable, and strong like a mountain
